Help.Tip: Choose between 3D mode and 2D mode for setting the grid parameters
Help.Text:
gridtrans - MODE
Choose between 3D mode and 2D mode for setting the grid parameters
 
 Default = 3D mode
 Allowed = 3D Mode
           2D Mode
 
 Allows the user to choose 3D mode or 2D mode for setting the grid transform
 parameters.  If 3D mode is selected, all screen elements are sensitive.  If
 2D mode, only the CMP INTERVAL and the X COORDINATE of one control point will
 be sensitive.

Help.Tip: Easting surveyed coordinate value of origin of the 3D-grid system.
Help.Text:
gridtrans - ORIGIN_EAST
Easting surveyed coordinate value of origin of the 3D-grid system.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real
 
 Easting surveyed coordinate value of the origin of the 3D-grid system.

Help.Tip: Northing surveyed coordinate value of origin of the 3D-grid system.
Help.Text:
gridtrans - ORIGIN_NORTH
Northing surveyed coordinate value of origin of the 3D-grid system.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real
 
 Northing surveyed coordinate value of the origin of the 3D-grid system.

Help.Tip: Physical distance associated with unit change in x-grid coordinate.
Help.Text:
gridtrans - X_GRID_DIST
Physical distance associated with unit change in x-grid coordinate.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real>0
 
 Physical distance in surveyed coordinate units, feet or meters, associated
 with a unit increment in the x-grid coordinate.  (Usually this will be the
 width of the stack bins in the x-grid direction.)

Help.Tip: Physical distance associated with unit change in y-grid coordinate.
Help.Text:
gridtrans - Y_GRID_DIST
Physical distance associated with unit change in y-grid coordinate.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real>0
 
 Physical distance in surveyed coordinate units, feet or meters, associated
 with a unit increment in the y-grid coordinate.  (Usually this will be the
 width of the stack bins in the y-grid direction.)

Help.Tip: Rotation Angle, in degrees, measured counter-clockwise
Help.Text:
gridtrans - ANGLE
Rotation Angle, in degrees, measured counter-clockwise
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real
 
 The rotation angle, in degrees, measured counter-clockwise from the east
 direction to the positive x-grid coordinate direction.

Help.Tip: Whether the 3D-grid coordinate system is right- or left-handed.
Help.Text:
gridtrans - HANDEDNESS
Whether the 3D-grid coordinate system is right- or left-handed.
 
 Default = RIGHT
 Allowed = RIGHT
           LEFT
 
 Whether the 3D-grid coordinate system is right-handed or left-handed.

Help.Tip: Forward rotation matrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - DX11
Forward rotation matrix
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 The rotation matrix for transforming from the Grid Coordinate System to the
 Surveyed Coordinate System.

Help.Tip: Forward rotation matrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - DX12
Forward rotation matrix
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real
 
 The rotation matrix for transforming from the Grid Coordinate System to the
 Surveyed Coordinate System.

Help.Tip: Forward rotation matrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - DX21
Forward rotation matrix
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real
 
 The rotation matrix for transforming from the Grid Coordinate System to the
 Surveyed Coordinate System.

Help.Tip: Forward rotation matrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - DX22
Forward rotation matrix
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 The rotation matrix for transforming from the Grid Coordinate System to the
 Surveyed Coordinate System.

Help.Tip: Inverse rotation matrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - DN11
Inverse rotation matrix
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 The rotation matrix for transforming from the Surveyed Coordinate System to
 the Grid Coordinate System.

Help.Tip: Inverse rotation matrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - DN12
Inverse rotation matrix
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real
 
 The rotation matrix for transforming from the Surveyed Coordinate System to
 the Grid Coordinate System.

Help.Tip: Inverse rotation matrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - DN21
Inverse rotation matrix
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real
 
 The rotation matrix for transforming from the Surveyed Coordinate System to
 the Grid Coordinate System.

Help.Tip: Inverse rotation matrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - DN22
Inverse rotation matrix
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 The rotation matrix for transforming from the Surveyed Coordinate System to
 the Grid Coordinate System.

Help.Tip: Pathname for the .jd file written by CFG.
Help.Text:
gridtrans - PATHNAME
Pathname for the .jd file written by CFG.
 
 Default =
 Allowed = char
 
 The pathname for a JD file to open and load the rotation matrix with the
 values found in the file header.

Help.Tip: Control point pairs used to calculate the rotation maxtrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - SURVEY_EAST
Control point pairs used to calculate the rotation maxtrix
 
 Default =
 Allowed = real
 
 The user may enter a list of control point pairs and push the RECALCULATE
 button at which time the front-end will calculate a grid transform for the
 user.  If four or more control point pairs are entered, then self-consistence
 is calculated and the residuals are displayed in the X_RESID and Y_RESID
 arrays.

Help.Tip: Control point pairs used to calculate the rotation maxtrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - SURVEY_NORTH
Control point pairs used to calculate the rotation maxtrix
 
 Default =
 Allowed = real
 
 The user may enter a list of control point pairs and push the RECALCULATE
 button at which time the front-end will calculate a grid transform for the
 user.  If four or more control point pairs are entered, then self-consistence
 is calculated and the residuals are displayed in the X_RESIDUAL and Y_RESIDUAL
 arrays.

Help.Tip: Control point pairs used to calculate the rotation maxtrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - GRID_X
Control point pairs used to calculate the rotation maxtrix
 
 Default =
 Allowed = real
 
 The user may enter a list of control point pairs and push the RECALCULATE
 button at which time the front-end will calculate a grid transform for the
 user.  If four or more control point pairs are entered, then self-consistence
 is calculated and the residuals are displayed in the X_RESIDUAL and Y_RESIDUAL

Help.Tip: Control point pairs used to calculate the rotation maxtrix
Help.Text:
gridtrans - GRID_Y
Control point pairs used to calculate the rotation maxtrix
 
 Default =
 Allowed = real
 
 The user may enter a list of control point pairs and push the RECALCULATE
 button at which time the front-end will calculate a grid transform for the
 user.  If four or more control point pairs are entered, then self-consistence
 is calculated and the residuals are displayed in the X_RESIDUAL and Y_RESIDUAL

Help.Tip: Difference between input and calculated grid coordinates
Help.Text:
gridtrans - X_RESIDUAL
Difference between input and calculated grid coordinates
 
 Default =
 Allowed = real
 
 The user may enter a list of control point pairs and push the RECALCULATE
 button at which time the front-end will calculate a grid transform for the
 user.  If four or more control point pairs are entered, then self-consistence
 is calculated and the residuals are displayed in the X_RESIDUAL and Y_RESIDUAL
 arrays.

Help.Tip: Difference between input and calculated grid coordinates
Help.Text:
gridtrans - Y_RESIDUAL
Difference between input and calculated grid coordinates
 
 Default =
 Allowed = real
 
 The user may enter a list of control point pairs and push the RECALCULATE
 button at which time the front-end will calculate a grid transform for the
 user.  If four or more control point pairs are entered, then self-consistence
 is calculated and the residuals are displayed in the X_RESIDUAL and Y_RESIDUAL
 arrays.

Help.Tip: Recalculate grid transform
Help.Text:
gridtrans - RECALCULATE
Recalculate grid transform
 
 The user may enter a list of control point pairs and push the RECALCULATE
 button at which time the front-end will calculate a grid transform for the
 user.  If four or more control point pairs are entered, then self-consistence
 is calculated and the residuals are displayed in the X_RESIDUAL and Y_RESIDUAL
 arrays.

Help.Tip: Close Pop-up Window
Help.Text:
gridtrans - CLOSE
Close Pop-up Window
 
 Button that closes the GRID_TRANSFORM_PARAMETERS pop-up window.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                        C P S   P R I M I T I V E
 
 Name       : gridtrans
 Category   : miscellaneous
 Written    : 1999-10-11   by: Donna K. Vunderink
 Revised    : 2006-11-14   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : A primitive used by project_data for grid transform parameters
 Portability: No known limitations.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 This primitive is the Grid Transform Parameters pop up window accessed via
 project_data.  The window allows the user to specify the parameters necessary
 to calculate the transform from survey coordinates to grid coordinates.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                            ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                           REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author       Description
     ----        ------       -----------
 14. 2006-11-14  D. Glover    Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
 13. 2006-06-01  Stoeckley    Add pc_register_array_names for SeisSpace.
 12. 2001-04-30  Vunderink    Fixed JD file pathname parameter to work with
                                CFE project/user defaults.
 11. 2001-03-13  Vunderink    Increased field widths and set grid transform
                                using grid_set_transform.
 10. 2000-10-12  Vunderink    Added JD file pathname parameter.
  9. 2000-10-06  Vunderink    Added missing help
  8. 2000-08-23  Vunderink    Made parameter name changes required by
                                coordinate naming standards
  7. 2000-03-27  Vunderink    Make sure pointer arrays sent to pc_put are
                                allocated.
  6. 2000-02-23  Vunderink    Modified to make arrayset insensitive instead of
                                individual arrays.  Added gui definition to
                                documentation and updated documentation.
  5. 2000-02-10  Vunderink    Previous fix still left xwidth and ywidth not
                                saved into workfile.  This one should save all
                                gridtrans parameters to workfile.
  4. 2000-02-07  Vunderink    Modified gridtrans_set_grid to set processes
                                parameters from grid.
  3. 2000-02-01  Vunderink    Make mode recalculate, and control points
                                insensitive and comment out gets until grid
                                module routines are available.
  2. 2000-01-19  Vunderink    Completed documentation
  1. 1999-10-11  Vunderink    Initial version.
 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
